title: Biome Type Schema
description: Standardized enumeration of all possible biome and climate types in The Shadow Team Chronicles universe.

descriptions.description: Detailed explanations of each biome type (not part of the enum, provided for documentation)

tundra.description: Cold, treeless plain with permanently frozen subsoil, supporting mosses, lichens, and hardy grasses.

taiga.description: Cold coniferous forest characterized by evergreen trees like pine, spruce, and fir.

temperate_forest.description: Forest with distinct seasons, composed primarily of deciduous trees that shed leaves annually.

rainforest.description: Dense, humid forest with high rainfall and extraordinary biodiversity.

jungle.description: Thick, tangled vegetation in a tropical region with dense undergrowth and limited sunlight penetration.

grassland.description: Open area dominated by grasses rather than trees or shrubs.

savanna.description: Grassy plain with scattered trees, transitioning between grassland and forest.

chaparral.description: Shrubland or heathland vegetation adapted to hot, dry summers and mild, wet winters.

desert.description: Barren area with little precipitation and hostile conditions for plant and animal life.

wetland.description: Land area that is saturated with water, either permanently or seasonally.

bog.description: Wetland that accumulates peat due to incomplete decomposition of plant matter.

marsh.description: Wetland dominated by herbaceous plants rather than woody plants.

swamp.description: Wetland dominated by trees and woody vegetation.

mangrove.description: Coastal wetland featuring salt-tolerant trees and shrubs.

alpine.description: High-mountain environment above the tree line characterized by harsh conditions.

arctic.description: Polar region characterized by extremely cold temperatures and unique ecosystems.

coastal.description: Area where land meets sea or ocean, featuring beaches, cliffs, or tidal environments.

marine.description: Ocean or sea environment supporting saltwater ecosystems.

freshwater.description: Non-saline water environment including lakes, ponds, rivers, and streams.

coral_reef.description: Underwater ecosystem characterized by reef-building corals and extraordinary biodiversity.

deep_ocean.description: Profound depths of the ocean beyond sunlight penetration, characterized by high pressure and unique life forms.

volcanic.description: Area characterized by volcanic activity, featuring distinctive soils, thermal features, and specialized adaptations.

urban.description: Human-dominated environment featuring buildings, infrastructure, and artificial surfaces.

agricultural.description: Land modified for farming or raising livestock, featuring cultivated fields and managed ecosystems.

subterranean.description: Underground environment featuring caves, tunnels, and specialized ecosystems adapted to darkness.

magical_nexus.description: Area with concentrated magical energy that alters natural laws and supports unique flora and fauna.

corrupted.description: Environment twisted or degraded by dark forces, pollution, or magical contamination.

dimensional_anomaly.description: Region where normal physical laws are altered due to dimensional fractures or overlaps.

artificial_ecosystem.description: Engineered environment designed to mimic natural conditions or create entirely new ecological systems.
